main event: A military report described a sighting of a cigar-shaped object, approximately 60-80 feet long, at 2000 feet altitude on 20 February 1961.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 10 seconds and hovered before disappearing over the horizon., It appeared to change shape possibly due to a short trail., The object made no sound during the sighting., The sighting was reported by military personnel from Spokane Air Defense., The object's behavior was characteristic of a meteor becoming a bolide before disintegration.
witness description: military personnel including Major Williams and Lieutenant Gordon
